definition: to escape from the abyss of suffering/to shed off a wretched plight
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: How can I use this to get Nate off the hook?
sentences.chinese: 我怎樣才能利用這個，讓內特脫離苦海呢？

sentences.english: The emergence of another national movement is still Somalia's best hope of escaping misery.
sentences.chinese: 讓索馬里脫離苦海最大的希望還是再有一次國民運動。

sentences.english: I congratulate him, he finally escaped from suffering sea.
sentences.chinese: 我恭喜他終於脫離苦海了。

definition: restrain your grief, accept fate (condolence phrase)
to have boundless prospects
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
to stay calm/to keep one's composure
karmic retribution within one's lifetime
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
